intro: Calandrinia pilosiuscula var. tenella, commonly known as the dwarf hairpin weed, is a flowering plant native to South America. It is a member of the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its small, hairy stems and clusters of pink or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, disturbed soils and is often found in coastal areas. It has small, ovate leaves with a pubescent surface and produces capsule fruits that contain numerous small seeds. Due to its hardy nature, it is considered an invasive species in some regions.
